items.name: Get all Timeoff Requests
items.shortDescription: Imports all Timeoff Requests from any external application to your App.
items.description:
# Get all Timeoff Requests

This scenario enables your application to get a complete list of Timeoff Requests from any external application to your app's API in the same way. 

When receiving Timeoff Requests data from the external application, the data is transformed into a format supported by your app's API. Additionally, if needed, your customers can customize the data mapping based on their specific external application setup.

## How It Works

You will call a Integration.app REST API endpoint or SDK methods to retrieve a single page of Timeoff Requests along with the `cursor` if next page is available.
Repeate this request in a loop from your code to retrieve all Timeoff Requests page by page.

items.name: Continuously Import Timeoff Requests to my App
items.shortDescription: Import Timeoff Requests and receive created/updated or deleted events
items.description:
# Continuous Import of Timeoff Requests to Your App

This scenario enables your application to continuously sync Timeoff Requests from any external application to your app's API. It handles the initial import of Timeoff Requests and keeps them synchronized when a Timeoff Request is created, updated, or deleted in the external application.

When receiving Timeoff Requests data from the external application, the data is transformed into a format supported by your app's API. Additionally, if needed, your customers can customize the data mapping based on their specific external application setup.

## How It Works

1. **Initial Import**:
   - Perform the initial import by calling the Integration.app REST API or SDK in a loop from your code to retrieve data page by page.
   - Integration.app transforms the output into a consistent format compatible with your API, allowing you to save the data efficiently.

2. **Continuous Sync**:
   - Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created, updated, or deleted events.
   - Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
   - You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.

items.name: Delete Timeoff Balance
items.shortDescription: Deletes Timeoff Balance in any external application
items.description:
# Delete Timeoff Balance

This scenario allows your application to delete a Timeoff Balance from any external application. 
You will pass ID of the Timeoff Balance you want to delete and Integration.app will handle the rest.

## How It Works

1. **Delete Timeoff Balance API call**:
   - Call Integration.app REST API or SDK with ID of the Timeoff Balance you want to delete and Integration.app will send the correct request to the external app.

items.name: Create Timeoff Balance
items.shortDescription: Creates Timeoff Balance in any external application
items.description:
# Create Timeoff Balance

This scenario allows your application to create a Timeoff Balance in any external application in the same way. 
You will pass Timeoff Balance fields in any format your application support and Integration.app will handle mapping of them to the schema of any selected application.
Additionally, if needed, your customers can customize the data mapping based on their specific setup.


## How It Works

1. **Configuration**:
   - You will setup the schema of fields that you wish to create Timeoff Balance with and configure mapping to our default model

2. **Create Timeoff Balance API call**:
   - Call Integration.app REST API or SDK with payload matching the field mapping you configured. You can run it for any external application via the same request.
   - When called, Integration.app transforms your Timeoff Balance data into a format compatible with the selected external application.
   - It then makes an API call to create the Timeoff Balance in that specific application.

items.name: Two-way realtime sync of Timeoff Balances
items.shortDescription: Bi-directional realtime sync of Timeoff Balances with records deduplication
items.description:
# Realtime Full two-way Sync of Timeoff Balances

This scenario enables your application to fully sync Timeoff Balances between your app and any external application in both directions. It handles the initial import/export of Timeoff Balances and then sends events when a Timeoff Balance is created, updated, or deleted on any side, as close to real-time as possible.

Timeoff Balance fields will be mapped from your application's schema to the application-specific schema.

## How It Works

1. **Initial Sync**:
   - Perform the initial import by calling the Integration.app REST API or SDK in a loop from your code to retrieve data page by page. Integration.app transforms the output into a consistent format compatible with your API, allowing you to save and match data efficiently.
   - Make another set of requests to create Timeoff Balances in external app, if needed.

2. **Continuous Sync from External App**:
   - Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created, updated, or deleted events from external applications.
   - Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
   - You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.


2. **Continuous Sync from Your App**:
   - You will get a single webhook URI that you will use to send events about created, updated, or deleted Timeoff Balances to Integration.app.
   - Once send, Integration.app will map the webhook payload to the format supported by external application and send the correct request

This scenario enables your application to fully sync Timeoff Requests between your app and any external application in both directions. It handles the initial import/export of Timeoff Requests and then sends events when a Timeoff Request is created, updated, or deleted on any side, as close to real-time as possible.

   - Make another set of requests to create Timeoff Requests in external app, if needed.

2. **Continuous Sync from External App**:
   - Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created, updated, or deleted events from external applications.
   - Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
   - You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.


2. **Continuous Sync from Your App**:
   - You will get a single webhook URI that you will use to send events about created, updated, or deleted Timeoff Requests to Integration.app.
   - Once send, Integration.app will map the webhook payload to the format supported by external application and send the correct request

items.name: Job Applications Unified API
items.description:
# Job Application Unified API

This scenario contains the complete Job Applications Unified API into your workspace. You will be able to seamlessly create, update, delete, and search Job Applications while also receiving notifications on creation, updates, and deletions of Job Applications in external applications. 

Integration.app will automatically manage the mapping of data to the unified schema, eliminating any concerns about differences across external applications. Additionally, youll have the flexibility to customize mappings for specific applications or customers, ensuring compatibility with their unique configurations when needed.

items.name: Send Message To Slack Channel
items.shortDescription: This action will send a message to a slack channel
items.description:
This scenario will show how to send a message to a Slack channel

## Send Message To a Slack Channel Action

We created `send-message-to-slack-channel` action of type `create-data-record` that would send a message to a specific Slack channel, when called.
There are a few action parameters you should configure to make the action fully operational:

- `channel_id`: the ID of a slack channel you want a message to be sent to [required]
- `token_type`: whether you want a message to be sent on behalf of an authorized user or a slack app. Note that the `token_type` defaults to `bot` value, should you choose to leave it empty
- `message_blocks`: a list of blocks your message should consist of. More about the structure of building block you can read [here](https://app.slack.com/block-kit-builder/)

items.name: Two-way realtime sync of Customers
items.shortDescription: Bi-directional realtime sync of Customers with records deduplication
items.description:
# Realtime Full two-way Sync of Customers

This scenario enables your application to fully sync Customers between your app and any external application in both directions. It handles the initial import/export of Customers and then sends events when a Customer is created, updated, or deleted on any side, as close to real-time as possible.

Customer fields will be mapped from your application's schema to the application-specific schema.

## How It Works

1. **Initial Sync**:
   - Perform the initial import by calling the Integration.app REST API or SDK in a loop from your code to retrieve data page by page. Integration.app transforms the output into a consistent format compatible with your API, allowing you to save and match data efficiently.
   - Make another set of requests to create Customers in external app, if needed.

2. **Continuous Sync from External App**:
   - Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created, updated, or deleted events from external applications.
   - Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
   - You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.


2. **Continuous Sync from Your App**:
   - You will get a single webhook URI that you will use to send events about created, updated, or deleted Customers to Integration.app.
   - Once send, Integration.app will map the webhook payload to the format supported by external application and send the correct request

items.name: Get all Files
items.shortDescription: Imports all Files from any external application to your App.
items.description:
# Get all Files

This scenario enables your application to get a complete list of Files from any external application to your app's API in the same way. 

When receiving Files data from the external application, the data is transformed into a format supported by your app's API. Additionally, if needed, your customers can customize the data mapping based on their specific external application setup.

## How It Works

You will call a Integration.app REST API endpoint or SDK methods to retrieve a single page of Files along with the `cursor` if next page is available.
Repeate this request in a loop from your code to retrieve all Files page by page.

items.name: Update Eeoc
items.shortDescription: Updates Eeoc in any external application
items.description:
# Update Eeoc

This scenario allows your application to update a Eeoc in any external application in the same way. 
You will pass  ID of the Eeoc you want to update and Eeoc fields in any format your application support and Integration.app will handle mapping of them to the schema of any selected application.
Additionally, if needed, your customers can customize the data mapping based on their specific setup.

## How It Works

1. **Configuration**:
   - You will setup the schema of fields that you wish to update Eeoc with and configure mapping to our default model

2. **Create Eeoc API call**:
   - Call Integration.app REST API or SDK with payload matching the field mapping you configured and ID. You can run it for any external application via the same request.
   - When called, Integration.app transforms your Eeoc data into a format compatible with the selected external application.
   - It then makes an API call to update the Eeoc in that specific application.

items.shortDescription: Bi-directional realtime sync of Drives with records deduplication
items.description:
# Realtime Full two-way Sync of Drives

This scenario enables your application to fully sync Drives between your app and any external application in both directions. It handles the initial import/export of Drives and then sends events when a Drive is created, updated, or deleted on any side, as close to real-time as possible.

Drive fields will be mapped from your application's schema to the application-specific schema.

## How It Works

1. **Initial Sync**:
   - Perform the initial import by calling the Integration.app REST API or SDK in a loop from your code to retrieve data page by page. Integration.app transforms the output into a consistent format compatible with your API, allowing you to save and match data efficiently.
   - Make another set of requests to create Drives in external app, if needed.

2. **Continuous Sync from External App**:
   - Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created, updated, or deleted events from external applications.
   - Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
   - You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.


2. **Continuous Sync from Your App**:
   - You will get a single webhook URI that you will use to send events about created, updated, or deleted Drives to Integration.app.
   - Once send, Integration.app will map the webhook payload to the format supported by external application and send the correct request

# Enrich newly created Companies

This scenario enables your application to enrich with the new data any newly createad Companies in external application. 

It handles subscription to the created events and Company fields mapping from your application's schema to the application-specific schema.

## How It Works
1. **Configuration**:
   - You will setup the schema of fields that you wish to enrich Company with and configure mapping to our default model.
   - If needed - your customer can customize this mapping based on their specific setup or even custom fields

2. **Enable receiving of Company created events**:
   - Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created events from external applications.
   - Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
   - You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.

2. **React to created Companies**:
   - Integration.app flow will be launched when new Company is created
   - It will send existing data to your app API, so you can decide how to enrich. Your API will return enriched data.
   - Integration.app will send enriched data to the external application mapped to the supported format based on the configuration above

items.name: Push Contacts To List
items.shortDescription: Create or add an existing contact to a list/campaign
items.description:
# Push Contact to a List

This scenario enables you to add a contact to a list in any external application.

## How It Works

1. **Fetch Available Contact Lists**:
   - Start by making an API request to retrieve all available lists in the application.
   - Select the specific list ID from the retrieved data.

2. **Add Contact to List**:
   - Make another API request to add Contact to the selected list by passing contact data and selected list id.
   - Integration.app will attempt to find a matching contact by its email and add it to the specified list.
   - If a contact with that email is not found, a new contact will be created using the provided data and then added to the list.

items.name: Two-way realtime sync of Eeocs
items.shortDescription: Bi-directional realtime sync of Eeocs with records deduplication
items.description:
# Realtime Full two-way Sync of Eeocs

This scenario enables your application to fully sync Eeocs between your app and any external application in both directions. It handles the initial import/export of Eeocs and then sends events when a Eeoc is created, updated, or deleted on any side, as close to real-time as possible.

Eeoc fields will be mapped from your application's schema to the application-specific schema.

## How It Works

1. **Initial Sync**:
   - Perform the initial import by calling the Integration.app REST API or SDK in a loop from your code to retrieve data page by page. Integration.app transforms the output into a consistent format compatible with your API, allowing you to save and match data efficiently.
   - Make another set of requests to create Eeocs in external app, if needed.

2. **Continuous Sync from External App**:
   - Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created, updated, or deleted events from external applications.
   - Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
   - You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.


2. **Continuous Sync from Your App**:
   - You will get a single webhook URI that you will use to send events about created, updated, or deleted Eeocs to Integration.app.
   - Once send, Integration.app will map the webhook payload to the format supported by external application and send the correct request

items.name: Continuously Enrich Deals
items.shortDescription: Receive all newly created deals, send it to your app API to enrich with the new data and update deal back
items.description:
# Enrich newly created Deals

This scenario enables your application to enrich with the new data any newly createad Deals in external application. 

It handles subscription to the created events and Deal fields mapping from your application's schema to the application-specific schema.

## How It Works
1. **Configuration**:
   - You will setup the schema of fields that you wish to enrich Deal with and configure mapping to our default model.
   - If needed - your customer can customize this mapping based on their specific setup or even custom fields

2. **Enable receiving of Deal created events**:
   - Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created events from external applications.
   - Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
   - You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.

2. **React to created Deals**:
   - Integration.app flow will be launched when new Deal is created
   - It will send existing data to your app API, so you can decide how to enrich. Your API will return enriched data.
   - Integration.app will send enriched data to the external application mapped to the supported format based on the configuration above

items.name: Two-way realtime sync of Products
items.shortDescription: Bi-directional realtime sync of Products with records deduplication
items.description:
# Realtime Full two-way Sync of Products

This scenario enables your application to fully sync Products between your app and any external application in both directions. It handles the initial import/export of Products and then sends events when a Product is created, updated, or deleted on any side, as close to real-time as possible.

Product fields will be mapped from your application's schema to the application-specific schema.

## How It Works

1. **Initial Sync**:
   - Perform the initial import by calling the Integration.app REST API or SDK in a loop from your code to retrieve data page by page. Integration.app transforms the output into a consistent format compatible with your API, allowing you to save and match data efficiently.
   - Make another set of requests to create Products in external app, if needed.

2. **Continuous Sync from External App**:
   - Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created, updated, or deleted events from external applications.
   - Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
   - You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.


2. **Continuous Sync from Your App**:
   - You will get a single webhook URI that you will use to send events about created, updated, or deleted Products to Integration.app.
   - Once send, Integration.app will map the webhook payload to the format supported by external application and send the correct request

items.name: Continuously Enrich Job Candidates
items.shortDescription: Receive all newly created job-candidates, send it to your app API to enrich with the new data and update job-candidate back
items.description:
# Enrich newly created Job Candidates

This scenario enables your application to enrich with the new data any newly createad Job Candidates in external application. 

It handles subscription to the created events and Job Candidate fields mapping from your application's schema to the application-specific schema.

## How It Works
1. **Configuration**:
   - You will setup the schema of fields that you wish to enrich Job Candidate with and configure mapping to our default model.
   - If needed - your customer can customize this mapping based on their specific setup or even custom fields

2. **Enable receiving of Job Candidate created events**:
   - Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created events from external applications.
   - Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
   - You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.

2. **React to created Job Candidates**:
   - Integration.app flow will be launched when new Job Candidate is created
   - It will send existing data to your app API, so you can decide how to enrich. Your API will return enriched data.
   - Integration.app will send enriched data to the external application mapped to the supported format based on the configuration above

items.name: Create Journal Entry
items.shortDescription: Creates a generic journal entry in accounting software.
items.description:
# Create Journal Entry

This scenario creates a generic Journal Entry in accounting software.

## How it works

Detailed guide: [Pushing data to external apps](https://console.integration.app/w/677c3abe83738d3e42ec0fcc/docs/building/use-cases/data-push).

This scenario uses a single action with standard imports matching our "Journal Entry" universal data model.

Since journal entries are typically standard, this scenario does not use any customer-level configurations like field mappings.

## Dependencies

You will need to import at least Ledger Accounts from the connected app in order to link journal entries with correct accounts.

For more complex scenarios, you may also need to import other entities, such as Customers, Vendors, or Inventory Items.

items.name: Update Job
items.shortDescription: Updates Job in any external application
items.description:
# Update Job

This scenario allows your application to update a Job in any external application in the same way. 
You will pass  ID of the Job you want to update and Job fields in any format your application support and Integration.app will handle mapping of them to the schema of any selected application.
Additionally, if needed, your customers can customize the data mapping based on their specific setup.

## How It Works

1. **Configuration**:
   - You will setup the schema of fields that you wish to update Job with and configure mapping to our default model

2. **Create Job API call**:
   - Call Integration.app REST API or SDK with payload matching the field mapping you configured and ID. You can run it for any external application via the same request.
   - When called, Integration.app transforms your Job data into a format compatible with the selected external application.
   - It then makes an API call to update the Job in that specific application.

items.name: Two-way realtime sync of Meetings
items.shortDescription: Bi-directional realtime sync of Meetings with records deduplication
items.description:
# Realtime Full two-way Sync of Meetings

This scenario enables your application to fully sync Meetings between your app and any external application in both directions. It handles the initial import/export of Meetings and then sends events when a Meeting is created, updated, or deleted on any side, as close to real-time as possible.

Meeting fields will be mapped from your application's schema to the application-specific schema.

## How It Works

1. **Initial Sync**:
   - Perform the initial import by calling the Integration.app REST API or SDK in a loop from your code to retrieve data page by page. Integration.app transforms the output into a consistent format compatible with your API, allowing you to save and match data efficiently.
   - Make another set of requests to create Meetings in external app, if needed.

2. **Continuous Sync from External App**:
   - Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created, updated, or deleted events from external applications.
   - Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
   - You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.


2. **Continuous Sync from Your App**:
   - You will get a single webhook URI that you will use to send events about created, updated, or deleted Meetings to Integration.app.
   - Once send, Integration.app will map the webhook payload to the format supported by external application and send the correct request

items.name: Get all Payments
items.shortDescription: Imports all Payments from any external application to your App.
items.description:
# Get all Payments

This scenario enables your application to get a complete list of Payments from any external application to your app's API in the same way. 

When receiving Payments data from the external application, the data is transformed into a format supported by your app's API. Additionally, if needed, your customers can customize the data mapping based on their specific external application setup.

## How It Works

You will call a Integration.app REST API endpoint or SDK methods to retrieve a single page of Payments along with the `cursor` if next page is available.
Repeate this request in a loop from your code to retrieve all Payments page by page.

# Get all Invoices

This scenario enables your application to get a complete list of Invoices from any external application to your app's API in the same way. 

When receiving Invoices data from the external application, the data is transformed into a format supported by your app's API. Additionally, if needed, your customers can customize the data mapping based on their specific external application setup.

You will call a Integration.app REST API endpoint or SDK methods to retrieve a single page of Invoices along with the `cursor` if next page is available.
Repeate this request in a loop from your code to retrieve all Invoices page by page.

items.name: Download File
items.shortDescription: Download files from Box, Dropbox, Google Drive, OneDrive or Microsoft SharePoint.
items.description:
# Download File


This scenario allows your application to download files from Box, Dropbox, Google Drive, OneDrive or Microsoft SharePoint.
File fields will be mapped from schema supported by your application to the application-specific schema

## How it works

1. **Download File**:
   - Call Integration.app REST API or SDK with file ID from external app.
   - When called, Integration.app retrieves the requested file from the original storage, and provides you with a temporary download link. This guarantees same interface for you for downloading files in the same way from any application

2. **Configuration options**:
    - You can get small files via Actions or use this action in Flow to download large files up to a few GBs.
    - Google drive: Since Google Drive supports Docs, Sheets, Slides and more in addition to uploaded files,
you can use an additional `exportAs` parameter to specify which MIME-type (out of [supported](https://developers.google.com/drive/api/guides/ref-export-formats)) you want to export the file to.
By default, we export Google Docs in the Microsoft Office formats (.docx, .xlsx, .pptx).

items.name: Get all Leads

# Get all Leads

This scenario enables your application to get a complete list of Leads from any external application to your app's API in the same way. 

When receiving Leads data from the external application, the data is transformed into a format supported by your app's API. Additionally, if needed, your customers can customize the data mapping based on their specific external application setup.

## How It Works

You will call a Integration.app REST API endpoint or SDK methods to retrieve a single page of Leads along with the `cursor` if next page is available.
Repeate this request in a loop from your code to retrieve all Leads page by page.

items.name: Continuously Enrich Contacts
items.shortDescription: Receive all newly created contacts, send it to your app API to enrich with the new data and update contact back
items.description:
# Enrich newly created Contacts

This scenario enables your application to enrich with the new data any newly createad Contacts in external application. 

It handles subscription to the created events and Contact fields mapping from your application's schema to the application-specific schema.

## How It Works
1. **Configuration**:
   - You will setup the schema of fields that you wish to enrich Contact with and configure mapping to our default model.
   - If needed - your customer can customize this mapping based on their specific setup or even custom fields

2. **Enable receiving of Contact created events**:
   - Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created events from external applications.
   - Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
   - You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.

2. **React to created Contacts**:
   - Integration.app flow will be launched when new Contact is created
   - It will send existing data to your app API, so you can decide how to enrich. Your API will return enriched data.
   - Integration.app will send enriched data to the external application mapped to the supported format based on the configuration above

   - Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created, updated, or deleted events.
   - Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
   - You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.

   - You will setup the schema of fields that you wish to create File with and configure mapping to our default model

items.name: Two-way realtime sync of Folders
items.shortDescription: Bi-directional realtime sync of Folders with records deduplication
items.description:
# Realtime Full two-way Sync of Folders

This scenario enables your application to fully sync Folders between your app and any external application in both directions. It handles the initial import/export of Folders and then sends events when a Folder is created, updated, or deleted on any side, as close to real-time as possible.

Folder fields will be mapped from your application's schema to the application-specific schema.

## How It Works

1. **Initial Sync**:
   - Perform the initial import by calling the Integration.app REST API or SDK in a loop from your code to retrieve data page by page. Integration.app transforms the output into a consistent format compatible with your API, allowing you to save and match data efficiently.
   - Make another set of requests to create Folders in external app, if needed.

2. **Continuous Sync from External App**:
   - Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created, updated, or deleted events from external applications.
   - Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
   - You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.


2. **Continuous Sync from Your App**:
   - You will get a single webhook URI that you will use to send events about created, updated, or deleted Folders to Integration.app.
   - Once send, Integration.app will map the webhook payload to the format supported by external application and send the correct request

items.name: Two-way realtime sync of Messages
items.shortDescription: Bi-directional realtime sync of Messages with records deduplication
items.description:
# Realtime Two-Way Sync of Messages

This scenario enables your application to fully sync Messages between your app and any external application in both directions. It handles the initial import/export of Messages and then sends events when a Message is created, updated, or deleted on any side, as close to real-time as possible.

Message fields will be mapped from your application's schema to the application-specific schema using Integration.app's Universal Data Model.

## How It Works

### 1. Initial Sync

- **Import Messages**: Perform the initial import by calling the Integration.app REST API or SDK in a loop from your code to retrieve data page by page. Integration.app transforms the output into a consistent format compatible with your API, allowing you to save and match data efficiently.
- **Export Messages**: Make another set of requests to create Messages in external app, if needed.
- **User Platform Mapping**: Store mappings between your internal customer IDs and external platform user IDs/emails to correctly identify message senders and recipients.
- **User ID Fetching**: Integration.app fetches user IDs during the initial sync process, ensuring proper user identification when sending messages and maintaining accurate sender/recipient mapping across all platforms.

### 2. Continuous Sync from External App

- **Webhook Subscription**: Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created, updated, or deleted events from external applications.
- **Integration.app Management**: Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
- **Real-time Events**: You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.
- **Smart Integration Detection**: Extract integration information from UserPlatform records using customerId + platformName instead of relying on webhook payload.

### 3. Continuous Sync from Your App

- **Webhook URI**: You will get a single webhook URI that you will use to send events about created, updated, or deleted Messages to Integration.app.
- **Automatic Mapping**: Once sent, Integration.app will map the webhook payload to the format supported by external application and send the correct request.

## Universal Message Handling

**Email threads and emails are handled the same way as chat channels and direct messages.** This unified approach means:

- **Email Threads = Chat Channels**: Each email conversation thread is treated as a chat channel, allowing you to manage email discussions alongside team chats and direct messages.
- **Individual Emails = Messages**: Each email within a thread is treated as a message, maintaining the conversation flow and threading structure.
- **Consistent Interface**: Whether you're working with Slack channels, Gmail threads, Teams conversations, or WhatsApp chats, the same interface and workflow applies.
- **Cross-Platform Conversations**: You can seamlessly switch between email threads and chat conversations, with all messages appearing in a unified timeline.

This design enables true unified messaging where email and chat communications are treated as equal participants in your messaging ecosystem.

## Getting Started

1. **Connect Integrations**: Use the integrations dialog to connect your messaging platforms
2. **Import Chats**: Select and import conversations from connected platforms
3. **Sync Messages**: Perform initial message synchronization
4. **Real-time Updates**: Receive and send messages in real-time through webhooks

This scenario enables your application to continuously sync Job Candidates from any external application to your app's API. It handles the initial import of Job Candidates and keeps them synchronized when a Job Candidate is created, updated, or deleted in the external application.

When receiving Job Candidates data from the external application, the data is transformed into a format supported by your app's API. Additionally, if needed, your customers can customize the data mapping based on their specific external application setup.

## How It Works

1. **Initial Import**:
   - Perform the initial import by calling the Integration.app REST API or SDK in a loop from your code to retrieve data page by page.
   - Integration.app transforms the output into a consistent format compatible with your API, allowing you to save the data efficiently.

2. **Continuous Sync**:
   - Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created, updated, or deleted events.
   - Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
   - You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.

items.name: Create Project
items.shortDescription: Creates Project in any external application
items.description:
# Create Project

This scenario allows your application to create a Project in any external application in the same way. 
You will pass Project fields in any format your application support and Integration.app will handle mapping of them to the schema of any selected application.
Additionally, if needed, your customers can customize the data mapping based on their specific setup.


## How It Works

1. **Configuration**:
   - You will setup the schema of fields that you wish to create Project with and configure mapping to our default model

2. **Create Project API call**:
   - Call Integration.app REST API or SDK with payload matching the field mapping you configured. You can run it for any external application via the same request.
   - When called, Integration.app transforms your Project data into a format compatible with the selected external application.
   - It then makes an API call to create the Project in that specific application.

items.name: Two-way realtime sync of Tax Rates
items.shortDescription: Bi-directional realtime sync of Tax Rates with records deduplication
items.description:
# Realtime Full two-way Sync of Tax Rates

This scenario enables your application to fully sync Tax Rates between your app and any external application in both directions. It handles the initial import/export of Tax Rates and then sends events when a Tax Rate is created, updated, or deleted on any side, as close to real-time as possible.

Tax Rate fields will be mapped from your application's schema to the application-specific schema.

## How It Works

1. **Initial Sync**:
   - Perform the initial import by calling the Integration.app REST API or SDK in a loop from your code to retrieve data page by page. Integration.app transforms the output into a consistent format compatible with your API, allowing you to save and match data efficiently.
   - Make another set of requests to create Tax Rates in external app, if needed.

2. **Continuous Sync from External App**:
   - Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created, updated, or deleted events from external applications.
   - Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
   - You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.


2. **Continuous Sync from Your App**:
   - You will get a single webhook URI that you will use to send events about created, updated, or deleted Tax Rates to Integration.app.
   - Once send, Integration.app will map the webhook payload to the format supported by external application and send the correct request

items.name: Get all Activities
items.shortDescription: Imports all Activities from any external application to your App.
items.description:
# Get all Activities

This scenario enables your application to get a complete list of Activities from any external application to your app's API in the same way. 

When receiving Activities data from the external application, the data is transformed into a format supported by your app's API. Additionally, if needed, your customers can customize the data mapping based on their specific external application setup.

## How It Works

You will call a Integration.app REST API endpoint or SDK methods to retrieve a single page of Activities along with the `cursor` if next page is available.
Repeate this request in a loop from your code to retrieve all Activities page by page.

# Continuous Import of Ledger Accounts to Your App

This scenario enables your application to continuously sync Ledger Accounts from any external application to your app's API. It handles the initial import of Ledger Accounts and keeps them synchronized when a Ledger Account is created, updated, or deleted in the external application.

When receiving Ledger Accounts data from the external application, the data is transformed into a format supported by your app's API. Additionally, if needed, your customers can customize the data mapping based on their specific external application setup.

## How It Works

1. **Initial Import**:
   - Perform the initial import by calling the Integration.app REST API or SDK in a loop from your code to retrieve data page by page.
   - Integration.app transforms the output into a consistent format compatible with your API, allowing you to save the data efficiently.

2. **Continuous Sync**:
   - Enable subscription via a single API or SDK call to continuously receive created, updated, or deleted events.
   - Integration.app manages all integration-specific logic, including subscribing to/unsubscribing from webhooks, custom polling of events, or performing periodic full syncs.
   - You will only receive the necessary events as real-time as supported by the external application's API.
